actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of Tuesday, February 7, 2023,  the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of Tuesday, February 7, 2023, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

PN71:
        Adrienne C. Nelson, of Oregon, to be United States District Judge for the District of Oregon

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.


 PN72:
        Matthew L. Garcia, of New Mexico, to be United States District Judge for the District of New Mexico

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.


 PN74:
        Lindsay C. Jenkins, of Illinois, to be United States District Judge for the Northern District of Illinois

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.


 PN88:
        DeAndrea Gist Benjamin, of South Carolina, to be United States Circuit Judge for the Fourth Circuit

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 44. Record Vote Number: 7 



 PN92:
        Cindy K. Chung, of Pennsylvania, to be United States Circuit Judge for the Third Circuit

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 46. Record Vote Number: 8 


        -- By unanimous consent agreement, vote 2/13/2023.
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Peters, at  4:29 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until  3 p.m. on Monday, February 13, 2023.
